seo.title: Wan 2.5 – Text or Image to Video with Optional Audio (480p–1080p, 5–10s)
seo.description: Audio-ready 5–10s clips at 480p/720p/1080p. Text or image input, optional WAV/MP3 upload, native audio, prompt expansion toggle, and pay-as-you-go pricing in MaxVideoAI.

overview: Wan 2.5 in MaxVideoAI: audio-ready 5–10s clips from text or a single image, at 480p/720p/1080p. Optional WAV/MP3 upload, native audio when no track is provided, prompt expansion toggle, and per-second pricing by resolution.

hero.title: Wan 2.5 – Text or Image to Video with Optional Audio in MaxVideoAI (480p–1080p, 5–10s)
hero.intro: Wan 2.5 – Audio-Ready AI Video for Cinematic 5–10s Clips (480p/720p/1080p)
hero.badge: 480p/720p/1080p · 5–10s · Text or Image input · Optional audio

bestUseCases.title: Best use cases
items: 5 or 10 second hero beats with synchronized sound
Animating portraits, concept art or product stills with audio-backed motion
Cheap 480p look-dev before committing to 1080p finals
Localized story beats (English or Chinese prompts) with prompt expansion help
Sound-led concepts where music hits, SFX or VO define the moment

technicalOverview.label: Inputs
technicalOverview.body: Text → Video; Image → Video from a single still

technicalOverview.label: Audio
technicalOverview.body: Native audio if no track; optional WAV/MP3 upload (3–30 s, ~15 MB) trimmed/looped to 5 or 10 s

technicalOverview.label: Controls
technicalOverview.body: Prompt expansion toggle; optional seed; safety toggles

promptStructure.title: Text-to-Video with Wan 2.5
promptStructure.quote: [Duration] second [aspect ratio] cinematic shot of [subject] in [environment]. Camera [movement] while [main action] happens. Lighting [style], [grade] look. Audio: [ambience + music/SFX], optional dialogue: “[…]”.
promptStructure.description: Write prompts like a shot description plus sound notes: subject/tone, environment, camera, timing, lighting/look, and audio cues.
steps: Camera language (dolly, pan, crane, POV, orbit)
Lighting and look (golden hour, moody, neon, etc.)
Audio: ambience, SFX, music, optional short dialogue

tips.title: Tips & limits
items: Attach a trimmed 5–10s WAV/MP3 when you need visuals synced to beats
Use native audio (no upload) for quick ideation
Toggle Prompt expansion on for exploration, off for precise briefs
Iterate cheap at 480p, finish at 1080p once approved
Keep copy as overlays; tiny text/UI can be unreliable

prompts.title: Chrome concept car on downbeats (10s, 16:9)
prompts.prompt: 10s 16:9 cinematic shot of a chrome concept car emerging from foggy light pulses on synth downbeats. Wide to low-angle push, rain streaks, cool blue rim light, subtle flares. Audio: uploaded track as main music, add low rumble, thunder, raindrops, no dialogue.

prompts.title: Vertical fitness watch story (10s, 9:16)
prompts.prompt: 10s vertical shot of a fitness smartwatch on a runner’s wrist synced to an energetic electronic track: close-up on beat one with raindrops on glass; pull back on the first big hit as the runner sprints in slow motion on a neon-lit bridge; final beat swings to profile close-up with breath in cold air, watch display glowing. Audio: uploaded track + subtle footsteps, rain, breathing; no VO.

faqs.a: Yes. If you don’t upload a track, Wan generates native audio. If you upload WAV/MP3, your track is trimmed/looped to 5 or 10 seconds and used as the main audio.

faqs.q: What resolutions and durations should I use?
faqs.a: 480p/5s for fastest look-dev; 720p/5–10s for internal reviews and social; 1080p/10s for hero beats and client-ready shots.

faqs.q: Can Wan 2.5 handle vertical and square videos?
faqs.a: Yes. Choose 16:9, 9:16 or 1:1 before rendering; 9:16 is best for mobile-first placements.
Yes. Upload one still (portrait, product, concept art) and focus the prompt on motion, camera and audio.

faqs.q: How is Wan 2.5 priced versus other engines?
faqs.a: Per-second by resolution (0.05/0.10/0.15 $/s). It’s mid-tier: cheaper than premium long-form, more capable than ultra-budget silent engines.

custom.heroDesc1: Wan 2.5 lets you storyboard cinematic beats with built-in audio: prompt or image input, optional WAV/MP3, 5 or 10 seconds at 480p/720p/1080p.
custom.heroDesc2: Use it for hero beats and reveals where music, ambience or dialogue matter. Upload a track for tight sync or let Wan score the scene natively.
custom.whyTitle: Why Wan 2.5 is powerful inside MaxVideoAI
heroHighlights: Text → Video and Image → Video in one engine
Optional audio upload (WAV/MP3) to lock timing to music or VO
Native audio generation when no track is attached
5 or 10 second beats that feel like finished shots
Prompt expansion toggle to enrich short briefs
Pay-as-you-go pricing with clear per-second rates
Available in Europe, UK and worldwide via the MaxVideoAI wallet
Fits alongside Sora, Veo, Pika, Kling, MiniMax Hailuo for cross-engine tests
bestUseCases: Portraits, concept art or product stills animated with audio
Sound-led ideas where music hits or VO matter
custom.whatTitle: What Wan 2.5 Actually Is in MaxVideoAI
custom.whatIntro1: Wan 2.5 is a text-and-image-to-video model built for short cinematic clips with native audio.
custom.whatIntro2: In MaxVideoAI it’s a flexible, audio-ready engine with tiered pricing by resolution.
whatFlowSteps: 2. Choose Text → Video or Image → Video.
3. Set duration (5/10 s), resolution (480p/720p/1080p) and aspect ratio.
5. Decide if Prompt expansion stays on.
6. Paste a clear, cinematic prompt with subject, camera and sound.
custom.specNote: These specs describe Wan 2.5 exactly as you can use it today via MaxVideoAI.

specSections.title: Duration & Output
items: Durations: 5 s and 10 s
Resolutions: 480p, 720p, 1080p (24 fps)

specSections.title: Aspect Ratios
items: 16:9 – horizontal for web/YouTube
9:16 – vertical for TikTok/Reels/Shorts
1:1 – square for feeds and profiles

specSections.title: Inputs & File Types
items: Text prompts (single scene or short mini-sequence)
Image → Video: one still (PNG/JPG/JPEG/WebP/GIF/AVIF), ~25 MB, animated into 5/10 s
Audio input: WAV/MP3, 3–30 s, ~15 MB; trimmed/looped to match the clip

specSections.title: Audio
items: Native audio if no track is uploaded
Uploaded audio becomes the main soundtrack, trimmed or looped
Use uploads for beat-accurate timing; use native for quick drafts

specSections.title: Prompt Expansion
items: Optional LLM rewrite of short prompts
Enable for exploration; disable for literal control

specSections.title: Pricing
items: Runs from the shared MaxVideoAI wallet with live rates shown

custom.specValueProp: Wan 2.5 is the audio-ready short-form engine for 5–10s beats where visuals and sound need to land together.
custom.galleryIntro: Clips generated with the exact configuration you have access to in MaxVideoAI.
custom.gallerySceneCta: Open this scene in Generate and adapt it with your own script →
custom.promptIntro: Use shot-style prompts with camera and audio notes.
promptPatternSteps: Audio: ambience, SFX, music, short dialogue
custom.promptSkeleton: [Duration] second [aspect ratio] cinematic shot of [subject] in [environment]. Camera [movement] while [main action] happens. Lighting [style], [grade] look. Audio: [ambience + music/SFX], optional line: “[…]”.
custom.promptSkeletonNote: Keep it concise; add or remove audio cues depending on whether you upload a track.
custom.imageIntro: Animate a single still into an audio-backed beat.
imageFlow: Upload a portrait, product shot or concept art still.
Choose Image → Video, duration, resolution and aspect ratio.
Attach audio or let Wan generate it.
Prompt for motion (camera/subject) and how the beat ends at 5 or 10 s.
imageWhy: Concept art turned into audio-backed intro beats
custom.multishotIntro1: Wan 2.5 can tie visual movement to a specific track.
custom.multishotIntro2: Use downbeats and transitions as anchors in your prompt.
multishotTips: Trim audio to 5 or 10 s for precise beat placement
Call out when visuals should hit specific beats
Keep dialogue short and natural within 5–10 s
Draft with native audio; upload polished tracks for finals
custom.demoPromptLabel: 10 second 9:16 product story synced to uploaded track
demoPrompt: 10s vertical shot of a fitness smartwatch on a runner’s wrist, timed to an energetic electronic track.
Start: close-up on beat one with raindrops on glass.
Beat change: pull back to the runner sprinting in slow motion on a neon-lit bridge.
Final beat: swing to profile close-up with visible breath, display glowing.
Lighting: blue hour, bright highlights on metal.
Audio: uploaded track as main music + subtle footsteps, rain, breathing; no dialogue.
demoNotes: Single subject/environment with clear camera path.
Explicit cues for when hits land.
strengths: Short 5–10 s beats that feel complete
Audio + video together for trailers, intros and reveals
Flexible resolution tiers for cheap drafts and polished finals
Handles realistic or stylized content with clear prompts
boundaries: Max 10 s per render; stitch clips for longer stories
Plan a light sound pass in your editor for client work
Tiny text/UI may be unreliable; keep critical copy as overlays
Prompt expansion can change nuance; disable for literal control
custom.tipsFooter: Use Wan 2.5 when visuals and sound must land together—ideate cheap, finish in HD with your track.
safetyRules: No explicit sexual content or sexualized minors
Avoid hateful, harassing or extremist material
Don’t use real likeness without consent; avoid public figures
Prompts/images/audio may be blocked or modified by moderation layers
safetyInterpretation: Use Wan 2.5 for brand-safe, legal and ethical content
custom.safetyNote: Wan 2.5 outputs run through provider and MaxVideoAI safeguards.
custom.comparisonTitle: Wan 2.5 vs Sora 2 / Veo 3.1 / Pika – Quick Overview
comparisonPoints: Wan 2.5: audio-ready short beats with optional track upload and flexible resolution tiers
Sora 2: 720p with audio for realistic UGC-style and product scenes
Veo 3.1: controllable 720p/1080p with strong camera language and audio
Pika 2.2: stylized, silent animation for loops and playful visuals

faqs.a: Yes. Native audio if no track is uploaded; uploaded WAV/MP3 becomes the main soundtrack, trimmed or looped to 5/10 s.

faqs.q: What resolutions and durations should I use?
faqs.a: 480p/5s for fastest and cheapest tests; 720p/5–10s for internal and social; 1080p/10s for hero beats and client delivery.

faqs.q: Can Wan 2.5 handle vertical and square videos?
faqs.a: Yes—16:9, 9:16 or 1:1. Pick 9:16 for mobile-first placements.
Yes. Upload one still and focus the prompt on motion, camera and audio.

faqs.a: Per-second by resolution (0.05/0.10/0.15 $/s); mid-tier compared to premium long-form and ultra-budget silent engines.
